definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
cangue (wooden collar like stocks used to restrain and punish criminals in China)

sentences.english: Conclusion Integrative therapy should be taken for traumatic flail chest.
sentences.chinese: 結論創傷性連枷胸應採取綜合治療措施。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss the surgical experience of traumatic flail chest.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討創傷性連枷胸的治療經驗。

sentences.english: They beat it out with flails, he and the woman together.
sentences.chinese: 他和她用連枷摔打水稻脫粒，摔打完後再揚場。

sentences.english: We don't know of any other species that uses its body like a flail.
sentences.chinese: 我們並不清楚其他任何鳥類種羣是否將身體充當連枷。

sentences.english: Objective To study the clinical features and criteria of Flail arm syndrome (FAS).
sentences.chinese: 目的探討連枷臂綜合徵的臨牀特點和診斷標準。

definition: the beam of a steelyard/a balance arm
golden rooster stands on one leg (tai chi posture)/standing on one leg
